p: The link of T. solium infection and cancer is not new, O H Del Brutto (1997) discussed the possible implications between T. solium pathogeny with the development of brain tumors. Suppressing the host immune response around calcified cysticerci leads to intense astrocytic gliosis, which may contribute to the development of cerebral glioma [ 37]. A possible association between cysticercosis the appearance of brain tumors has also been described; DNA damage may occur in the cells surrounding cysticerci due to the host chronic inflammatory response. A similar association has been proposed between cysticercosis and the development of hematological malignancies, due to chromosomal aberrations [ 38].
